intro: Gymnostachyum pallens, commonly known as the white-flowered gymnostachyum, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are typically yellow or orange when mature. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
